page.title: 06CHICKEN FARMS
page.content: Within our area, there a number of chicken farms. The farms usually consist of about three or four large houses. The houses can hold as much as eight thousand birds each. The birds arrive when they are only a few days old and leave when they are about eight weeks old. Water and meal is fed to them automatically. The bird houses are heated by gas and they are given fresh air by fans. The temperature in the houses could be kept up to eighty degrees farenheit. The birds grow very quickly in conditions like these. When the birds are fully grown, they are taken back to the company from which they come. The company then cleans them to be sold to large shops and restaurants.
